definition: disaster and happiness
old variant of 禍|祸[huo4]
disaster/misfortune/calamity
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
fortune as unpredictable as the weather, every day may bring fortune or calamity (idiom); sth unexpected may happen at any moment
pinyin: tian1 you3 bu4 ce4 feng1 yun2 , ren2 you3 dan4 xi1 huo4 fu2
containing_words.word: 天有不测风云，人有旦夕祸福

definition: fate/portent/luck or disasters as foretold in the stars (astrology)
disaster and happiness do not follow rules (idiom); future blessings and misfortunes are unpredictable
to stick together through thick and thin (idiom)

sentences.english: The happy and the disaster are in together at anytime, we should accept it with normal attitude.
sentences.chinese: 任何时候祸福都是并存的，我们要放平心态去接受。

sentences.english: Fortune and misfortune are existence together in anytime , we should accept it with our normal attitude .
sentences.chinese: 任何时候祸福都是并存的，我们要放平心态去接受。

sentences.english: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?
sentences.chinese: 祸福不都出于至高者的口吗。

sentences.english: He believes that everybody's life is predestined.
sentences.chinese: 认为人生祸福早有定数。

sentences.english: No doubt we tasted the sour, sweet, bitter, hot, cold and engraved ring.
sentences.chinese: 不惑的我们尝遍了酸甜苦辣，冷暖祸福刻满了年轮。

definition: fate/portent/luck or disasters as foretold in the stars (astrology)
good and bad luck (in astrology)
life or death/critical (event)
one's fortune/destiny
to foretell/to predict
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
hard to fathom
constant (math.)/quota/fixed number (e.g. of places on a bus)/fixed quantity (e.g. load of truck)/destiny
providence/the Will of Heaven
life or death
disaster and happiness do not follow rules (idiom); future blessings and misfortunes are unpredictable
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
to divine using the trigrams/fortune telling
to predict by divining/to look into the future
supernatural beings
to divulge the will of heaven (idiom); to leak a secret/to let the cat out of the bag
